subject: Creativity
title: Conflict in Every Conversation: The Engine of Good Dialogue
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Conflict in Every Conversation: The Engine of Good Dialogue.

hook.text: Two friends agreeing on dinner is boring. Two friends debating where to eat while hiding resentment ‚Äî that's a real scene.

buildup.text: Every dialogue scene needs conflict ‚Äî not necessarily a fight, but opposing desires, hidden agendas, or power.

discovery.text: Robert McKee calls this 'the gap' ‚Äî the distance between what a character expects to happen in conversation and what.

twist.text: Quentin Tarantino's genius is putting enormous tension under casual conversation.

climax.text: If you can summarize a dialogue scene as 'they talked and agreed,' the scene has failed.

punchline.text: Dialogue without conflict is just two people making noise.

quiz.question: According to Robert McKee, what drives engaging dialogue?
options: The gap between expectation and reality
